intro: Mussaenda odorata, commonly known as the sweet-scented glory bush, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant has simple, opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Mussaenda odorata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant fragrance.
